Time of satellite crossing of the magnetic equator, UTC
Geographic longitude of satellite crossing of the magnetic equator
Geographic latitude of satellite crossing of the magnetic equator
Estimate of the equatorial electric field
Height-integrated east current profile in QD latitude, spanning [-20:0.5:20] degrees
Quality indicator of EEF estimate; relative error between modeled and observed current profile
Flags describing data gaps and satellite identification
Flags characterizing the product quality (processing flags)
Flags_F passed through from L1b and accumulated for quad points
Flags_B passed through from L1b and accumulated for quad points
Flags_q passed through from L1b and accumulated for quad points
GPS signal-to-noise ratio or raw signal strength on L1
GPS signal-to-noise ratio or raw signal strength on L2
Root mean square error of relative slant TEC
Error of the GPS receiver differential code bias
Plasma density, directly copied from the Langmuir probe files.
Background density, as calculated from Ne using a percentile filter of 551 datapoints (2 Hz raw data) and 35 as the percentile.
Foreground density, as calculated from ndens using a percentile filter of 7 datapoints (2 Hz raw data) and 50 as the percentile.
Electron temperature, directly copied from the Langmuir probe files.

The polar cap patch flag:  0 if the plasma density measurement occurred OUTSIDE a polar cap patch. 1 if the plasma density measurement occurred at one of the edges of a polar cap patch (no plasma velocity measurements are available). 2 if the plasma density measurement occurred at the LEADING edge of a polar cap patch. 3 if the plasma density measurement occurred at the TRAILING edge of a polar cap patch. 4 if the plasma density measurement occurred INSIDE a polar cap patch proper. When no ion drift data is available, the leading and trailing edges cannot be distinguished. In this case the polar cap patch flag is set to 4 throughout the patch proper and to 1 throughout both edges.
The electron density gradient in a running window calculated via linear regression over 27 data points for the 2 Hz electron density data.
The electron density gradient in a running window calculated via linear regression over 13 data points for the 2 Hz electron density data.
The electron density gradient in a running window calculated via linear regression over 5 data points for the 2 Hz electron density data.
The linear electron density gradient calculated over the edges of a patch. This variable is non-zero only at the edges of polar cap patches.
Rate Of change of Density Index (RODI) is the standard deviation of ROD over 10 seconds.
Rate Of change of Density Index (RODI) is the standard deviation of ROD over 20 seconds.
Derived by subtracting Ne by its median filtered value in 10 seconds. As a result, delta_Ne10s indicates the electron density fluctuations smaller than 75 km.
Derived by subtracting Ne by its median filtered value in 20 seconds. As a result, delta_Ne20s indicates the electron density fluctuations smaller than 150 km.
Derived by subtracting Ne by its median filtered value in 40 seconds. As a result, delta_Ne40s indicates the electron density fluctuations smaller than 300 km.
Total number of tracked GPS satellites above 20 degrees.
Median of VTEC from all available GPS satellites above 30 degrees.
Median of Rate Of change of TEC (ROT) from all available GPS satellites above 30 degrees.
Median of Rate Of change of TEC Index (ROTI) from all available GPS satellites above 30 degrees. The ROTI of each satellite is the standard deviation of ROT over 10 seconds.
Median of Rate Of change of TEC Index (ROTI) from all available GPS satellites above 30 degrees. The ROTI of each satellite is the standard deviation of ROT over 20 seconds.
Plasma Bubble Index, copied from the level-2 Ionospheric Bubble Index product, IBIxTMS_2F.
0: equator, 1: mid-latitudes; 2: auroral oval; 3: polar cap.
The numeric index for plasma fluctuations and irregularities: 0-3 low, 4-5 medium, and > 6 high level of ionosphericplasma irregularities.
Quality flag for the Ne data and the derived data from Ne, e.g., background density, foreground density etc.
STD of VTEC from all GPS satellites.
F10.7 - Daily 10.7 cm solar radio flux, units: 10**(-22) Joules/second/square-meter/Hertz, from NGDC (1963/001-2016/366)
North- and East-component of horizontal sheet current density vector in geographic frame
Eastward horizontal sheet current density in QD frame (positive in East QD direction)
Time instants of quality information (rms_misfit and confidence), UTC
Quality indicator: rms misfit between observations and model values of the four orbital sections
Goodness of fit computed as 1 - (residual variance / signal variance)
Point Type: 0 - EB0, 1 - EB1, 2 - PB0, 3 - PB1, 4 - Minimum, 5 - Maximum, 255 - No-data
Peak horizontal sheet current intensity in the QD frame (positive in East QD direction). Set to NaN for boundaries.
geodetic latitude of the ionospheric footprint
geodetic longitude of the ionospheric footprint
quasi-dipole latitude of the ionospheric footprint
quasi-dipole longitude of the ionospheric footprint
magnetic local time in quasi-dipole coordinates
Column 1: north component of the curl-free ionospheric current density in the spherical frame; column 2: east component of the curl-free ionospheric current density in the spherical frame
Column 1: north component of the divergence-free ionospheric current density in the spherical frame; column 2: east component of the divergence-free ionospheric current density in the spherical frame
theta component of the curl-free ionospheric current density in the SECS frame
phi component of the divergence-free ionospheric current density in the SECS frame
radial ionospheric current density in the SECS frame
Time instants of quality information (rms_misfit and confidence), UTC
root mean square error of the fitted Swarm magnetic field ((r,theta)-plane in DIP)
Point Type: 0 - EB0, 1 - EB1, 2 - PB0, 3 - PB1, 4 - Minimum, 5 - Maximum, 255 - No-data
UTC time of peak (minimum and maximum) ground magnetic field disturbance.
Position of peak (minimum and maximum) ground magnetic field disturbance in ITRF - Latitude
Position of peak (minimum and maximum) ground magnetic field disturbance in ITRF - Longitude
Peak ground magnetic field disturbance, NEC frame.
Position of equatorward/poleward boundary in ITRF - Geocentric latitude
Position of equatorward/poleward boundary in ITRF - Geocentric longitude
Position of equatorward/poleward boundary in ITRF - Radius from the Earth center
Magnetic local time of equatorward/poleward boundary
Indicator for equatorward (=1) or poleward (=2) boundary
Quality indicator of equatorward/poleward boundary (Pa, Sigma)

Indicator of equatorward/poleward boundary of auroral oval. If the auroral oval boundaries are detectable as one pair, the pair indicator represents the record of previous (-1) or next (1) equatorward/poleward boundary within one pair; otherwise, the pair indicator is set to 0
